content.question: Consider the curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane defined by <math alttext="y times the square root of y cubed plus 1, end root, equals x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> for <math alttext="y greater than negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. For what value of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="y greater than negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, does the derivative of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> not exist?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, negative two fifths, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, negative one fourth, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

The derivative of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> exists for all <math alttext="y greater than, negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, negative two fifths, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
